org.vngx.jsch

Class Channel

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.vngx.jsch.Channel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ChannelDirectTCPIP, ChannelExec, ChannelForwardedTCPIP, ChannelSftp, ChannelShell, ChannelSubsystem

    public abstract class Channel
extends Object
implements Runnable
    Default base implementation of a SSH channel and provides a centralized pool for tracking all channel instances. The connection protocol specifies a mechanism to multiplex multiple streams (channels) of data over the confidential and authenticated transport. It also specifies channels for accessing an interactive shell, for proxy-forwarding various external protocols over the secure transport (including arbitrary TCP/IP protocols), and for accessing secure subsystems on the server host. All terminal sessions, forwarded connections, etc., are channels. Either side may open a channel. Multiple channels are multiplexed into a single connection. Channels are identified by numbers at each end. The number referring to a channel may be different on each side. Requests to open a channel contain the sender's channel number. Any other channel-related messages contain the recipient's channel number for the channel. Channels are flow-controlled. No data may be sent to a channel until a message is received to indicate that window space is available. The initial assignments for the 'reason code' values and 'description' values are given in the table below. Note that the values for the 'reason code' are given in decimal format for readability, but they are actually uint32 values. Symbolic Name reason code ------------- ----------- SSH_OPEN_ADMINISTRATIVELY_PROHIBITED 1 SSH_OPEN_CONNECT_FAILED 2 SSH_OPEN_UNKNOWN_CHANNEL_TYPE 3 SSH_OPEN_RESOURCE_SHORTAGE 4 TODO Once a channel has failed connecting or has disconnected, it cannot be reused to connect again. Calling connect() methods should throw an exception if the state is closed.
    Author:
    Atsuhiko Yamanaka, Michael Laudati

      • connect

        public void connect()
             throws JSchException
        Connects the channel through the current session without any timeout. This is the equivalent of calling connect(0).
        Throws:
        JSchException - if any errors occur

      • connect

             throws JSchException
        Connects the channel through the current session with the specified timeout in milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        connectTimeout - in milliseconds
        Throws:
        JSchException - if any errors occur

      • start

        public void start()
           throws JSchException
        Starts the channel after connection through the session. Implementations can override this method to define specific behavior. TODO Should this method be publicly exposed? It's always called after a successful connection... should external code ever need to call it?
        Throws:
        JSchException

        Parameters:
        in - stream to read channel data
        dontClose - true to not close stream when channel closes

      • getOutputStream

        public OutputStream getOutputStream()
                             throws IOException
        Returns a new instance of OutputStream for writing output to the channel. A new instance is returned for each invocation rather than the same instance for use in a multi-threaded environment to preclude the need for external synchronization. (Two threads could be writing data to the channel concurrently)
        Returns:
        new instance of OutputStream to write output to channel
        Throws:
        IOException - if any errors occur

      • isEOF

        public final boolean isEOF()
        Returns true if the remote output has reached EOF.
        Returns:
        true if remote output is EOF

      • isClosed

        public final boolean isClosed()
        Returns true if this channel is closed.
        Returns:
        channel is closed for input/output

      • disconnect

        public final void disconnect()
        Disconnects the channel from the SSH server and cleans up any open resources. Calling this method when the channel is not connected has no effect.

      • isConnected

        public final boolean isConnected()
        Returns true if the channel is currently connected to the SSH server.
        Returns:
        true if session and channel are connected to SSH server

      • sendSignal

        public final void sendSignal(String signal)
                      throws Exception
        Sends the specified signal for this channel to the SSH server. A signal can be delivered to the remote process/service using the following message. Some systems may not implement signals, in which case they should ignore this message.
        Parameters:
        signal - to send
        Throws:
        Exception - if any errors occur

      • getExitStatus

        public final int getExitStatus()
        Returns the exit status code returned by the SSH server for the channel. When the command running at the other end terminates, the following message can be sent to return the exit status of the command. Returning the status is recommended. No acknowledgement is sent for this message. The channel needs to be closed with SSH_MSG_CHANNEL_CLOSE after this message. The remote command may also terminate violently due to a signal. Such a condition can be indicated by the following message. A zero 'exit_status' usually means that the command terminated successfully.
        Returns:
        exit status code

      • getSession

        public final Session getSession()
        Returns the Session instance this channel is opened on.
        Returns:
        session instance

      • getId

        public final int getId()
        Returns the unique ID for this channel.
        Returns:
        unique ID for channel

      • getType

        public final ChannelType getType()
        Returns the channel type.
        Returns:
        channel type
